div.p: Understorey palm. Stems solitary or clustered, 1-3 m tall, thin, 0.5-1.5 cm in diameter, unarmed. Leaf blade simple, bifid, 30-65 cm long, and 15-35 cm wide, without spines except for minute bristles along the margin; rachis 20-40 cm long. Inflorescences 5-13 cm long; branches 3-7 branches, to 5 cm long. Peduncular bract glabrous. Female flowers scattered along the branches, with a tubular calyx enclosing the corolla. Fruit red, globose, ca. 1 cm in diameter, smooth; fruiting perianth with a 3-lobed calyx as long as the 3-lobed corolla; staminodial ring absent.
S Colombia and Ecuador E of the Andes, on terra firme.

Sometimes included in Bactris simplicifrons (Henderson, 1995; Henderson et al., 1995), but different from that species in its usually simple leaf blade, with the veins forming a narrower angle with the rachis, and in its branched inflorescence.
